casebody.data:
The State of Ohio, Appellant, v. Dade, Appellee.

[Cite as State v. Dade, 100 Ohio St.3d 30, 2003-Ohio-4755.]

(No. 2002-1974 Submitted August 26, 2003 Decided September 24, 2003.)

{¶ 1} The judgment of the court of appeals is affirmed on the authority of State v. Brown, 99 Ohio St.3d 323, 2003-Ohio-3931, 792 N.E.2d 175.

Moyer, C.J., Resnick, F.E. Sweeney and Pfeifer, JJ., concur. *31Ron O’Brien, Franklin County Prosecuting Attorney, and Steven L. Taylor, Assistant Prosecuting Attorney, for appellant. Yeura Venters, Franklin County Public Defender, and Allen V. Adair, Assistant Public Defender, for appellee. Lundberg Stratton and O’Connor, JJ., dissent. O’Donnell, J., not participating. Lundberg Stratton, J.,

dissenting.

{¶ 2} I respectfully dissent for the reasons expressed in Justice O’Connor’s well-reasoned dissent in State v. Brown, 99 Ohio St.3d 323, 2003-Ohio-3931, 792 N.E.2d 175, ¶ 26-32.

O’Connor, J., concurs in the foregoing dissenting opinion.
